items.title: How Plessey Semiconductors is redefining reality with the next generation of AR and microLED innovations
Leading international tobacco company, JTI, serves over 130 markets and is now investing into its UK facilities
Ropsley Group’s investments in machinery enable it to meet the demands of the British power industry
Tritorc is redefining industrial maintenance solutions with high performance and precision
From naturally sourced materials to carbon-conscious processes, Playdale Playgrounds is at the forefront of sustainable playground design
Manufacturers brace for California’s scope 3 emissions mandate
Copan stakes its future on domestic production growth
FUJIFILM $3.2B Holly Springs plant shifts US biomanufacturing
items.summary:
- FUJIFILM opened a *$3.2B* commercial-scale cell culture plant in Holly Springs with eight 20,000L bioreactors (expanding to 16 by 2026) and targets ~1,400 jobs by 2031.
- The site accelerates *onshoring*, strengthens North Carolina’s biotech cluster, and gives US partners closer regulatory and supply proximity.
- FUJIFILM’s modular **kojoX** design raises scale and technology expectations, intensifies competition for skilled biotech talent, and boosts demand for local suppliers and *ESG*-focused site choices.

items.title: Innovation meets openness at 2025 World Manufacturing Convention
North American Manufacturers Leading Production of Top-Rated Aluminum Canopy Systems for Commercial Buildings
GSK joins industry push with $30B plan for US drug production
AI and robotics are redefining the factory floor
Who Are the Leading Manufacturers of Modular Cleanrooms in North America?
Airbus marks 10 years of growth in Alabama’s aerospace economy
Eli Lilly $5.3B Virginia drug manufacturing hub
items.summary:
- Eli Lilly is investing *$5.3B* in Concord, Virginia — its largest ever single investment — to build a domestic hub for **injectables** and active pharmaceutical ingredients, creating ~600 jobs.
- The facility enhances US *reshoring* and supply-chain resilience through vertical integration, continuous manufacturing, and support for demand for Mounjaro and Zepbound.
- Virginia may see ~$3B in secondary economic activity, though risks include construction delays, talent shortages and higher domestic costs.

items.title: Manufacturers abandon US amid global restructuring
items.summary:
- Nearly one in five international manufacturers have *exited the US*, driven by geopolitical stress, tariffs and compliance, prompting **friendshoring** to Mexico, Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe and North Africa.
- Firms are racing to adopt *AI* and digital planning to reshape supply chains, but integration hurdles and only ~10% full deployments leave many organizations exposed.
- The industrial map is being *redrawn*: US clusters may contract, winners will be digitally agile, and the OECD warns of risks from excessive **overlocalization**.

items.title: Top 7 digital manufacturing tools you need in 2025
items.summary:
- **Digital twins** provide a live virtual replica of assets, enabling *what-if* simulations, reducing downtime, and faster changeovers.
- **IIoT platforms** unify machinery, tools, and environments for real-time monitoring, edge processing, and predictive analytics.
- **AI-powered predictive maintenance & quality control** detect faults early, cut downtime, and boost consistency via digital twins and MES integration.

items.title: Apple details $600B plan to expand American manufacturing base
items.summary:
- *Apple* commits *$600B* over four years to expand domestic manufacturing, reshaping the *US* semiconductor supply chain.
- It deepens partnerships with *Taiwan Semiconductor*, *Texas Instruments*, and *Applied Materials*, expands to 79 factories nationwide, and backs a *$2.5B* Corning glass project.
- The move carries political and workforce implications, with the *Manufacturing Academy* in Detroit training workers and signaling a long-term shift toward domestic resilience.

items.title: Hitachi Energy commits $1B to US grid manufacturing
items.summary: - *Hitachi Energy* plans a $1B push to create a transformer hub in Virginia and expand plants in Tennessee, Pennsylvania, and Southwest Virginia. - The effort aligns with **Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act** and **Inflation Reduction Act** to boost *domestic supply* and grid resilience. - Risks include permitting and cost pressures, but the project would create **1,000+ jobs** and bolster long‑term **grid reliability**.

items.title: Divergent raises $290M to scale defence 3D printing
items.summary:
- Divergent Technologies just raised $290M (equity $250M + debt $40M) at a $2.3B valuation to scale its *Divergent Adaptive Production System (DAPS)* for defence and aerospace.
- The round blends equity and debt to accelerate digital design, metal additive manufacturing, and automated assembly, targeting local, scalable production and reduced supply-chain risks.
- With partners like *General Atomics*, *Lockheed Martin*, and *Raytheon*, the funding signals a shift to digital-first, production-ready manufacturing in national security programs.

items.title: Samsung, Amgen, Biocon invest in US pharma facilities
items.summary:
- *Samsung Biologics* signs a roughly $1.3B US contract through 2029, deepening its North American footprint to shield against tariff and supply-chain risk.
- *Amgen* expands in the US with a $600M innovation center in Thousand Oaks, plus earlier $900M Ohio and $1B North Carolina projects to speed development and simplify compliance.
- *Biocon* opens its first US plant in Cranbury (2B tablets/year) and sets North American HQ in Bridgewater to shorten lead times and grow its US generics business.

items.title: Digital Twin Maturity: Beginners, Optimizers, Leaders
items.summary:
- The article examines *Digital Twin* maturity stages: *Beginners*, *Optimizers*, and *Leaders*.
- It outlines a path from initial adoption to *data-driven* optimization and sustained value.
- The page is *password-protected*, limiting full access on Manufacturing Today.

items.title: Top Crane Operator Training Providers for Manufacturing
items.summary:
- The piece highlights five trusted providers—**CICB**, **Morrow Equipment Company**, **CraneSafe**, **Crane U**, and **Total Equipment Training**—offering OSHA-aligned training with on-site, classroom, simulators and NCCCO prep to boost safety.
- It lists decision factors such as accreditation, industry experience, flexibility, specialization and instructor expertise to match equipment and workforce.
- Well-trained operators reduce accidents, downtime and costs, while boosting safety culture and long-term value.

items.title: MRPeasy Surpasses 500 Active Clients in the UK
items.summary:
- MRPeasy hits a milestone with **500 active UK clients**, signaling strong value for small manufacturers.
- Globally, the platform serves **2,000+ paying clients in 60+ countries** with metrics like **67% better inventory tracking** and **54% efficiency gains**.
- Users praise *ease of use*, **scalability**, and real-time cost visibility that enable smarter planning and sustainable growth for UK SMEs.

items.title: Ford rides SUV demand while rivals double down on EVs
items.summary:
- The Expedition posted record August sales (8,724, +53.7%), showing *SUV* demand and the strength of *internal-combustion* models.
- Ford is trimming some EV investments and leaning into *hybrids* and core combustion lines to preserve margins, at the *Kentucky Truck Plant*.
- The trend underscores a broader market mix shift: strong demand for large *SUVs* even as automakers race to electrify, reshaping suppliers and long-term strategy.

items.title: Hitachi HQ moves to Michigan to transform manufacturing
items.summary:
- JR Automation, a *Hitachi* subsidiary, is investing *$72.8 million* to build a 286,000-square-foot global headquarters in *Zeeland, Michigan*, consolidating about 350 employees from West Michigan locations.
- The campus combines 210,000 square feet of assembly space with 76,000 square feet of offices and collaboration areas, includes on-site solar and a renewable-powered baseline, and will showcase automation tech powered by *Lumada*, including AI, robotics and real-time data analytics.
- The project strengthens Michigan's bid to become a *smart manufacturing hub*, with incentives from the *Michigan Economic Development Corporation* and Gov. Whitmer, positioning Zeeland as a flagship site for Hitachi's global strategy and workforce development.

items.title: US Strategic Metals-Pakistan $500M mineral pact
items.summary:
- US Strategic Metals signs a **$500 million** deal with Pakistan’s Frontier Works Organization to build a poly‑metallic refinery and expand exports of *copper*, *antimony*, *gold*, *tungsten*, and *rare earth elements*.
- The plan shifts Pakistan from raw exports to in‑country processing, boosting local jobs, tech transfer, and closer ties to US supply chains.
- Security risks in Balochistan persist, but protections are pledged as interest from Barrick Gold and others grows, signaling Pakistan as a regional mineral hub.

items.title: GE Aerospace backs BETA to spark hybrid electric flight
items.summary:
- GE Aerospace commits a $300M investment with *BETA Technologies* to create a turbogenerator for *hybrid electric propulsion* in civil and defense aviation.
- The alliance blends GE's turbine power systems with *BETA's electric propulsion* to enable longer-range, faster eVTOLs and may include a board seat for GE, subject to regulators.
- The deal highlights a rising *Advanced Air Mobility* market, with strong growth forecasts and broad manufacturing shifts across supply chains and the workforce.

items.title: Natron Energy collapse signals struggles for US battery manufacturing
items.summary:
- Natron Energy shut down its California and Michigan ops and canceled a planned $1.4B NC gigafactory, showing that *innovation* alone won't guarantee success in the *capital-intensive* battery market.
- Its *sodium-ion* ambitions promised safer, cobalt- and nickel-free storage, but it failed to secure enough funding or orders to scale, so the project never materialized.
- The episode underscores a brutal market requiring large upfront investment and a coordinated push to build a domestic *energy-storage ecosystem*, with lessons for policy and investors as firms like *Powin* and *Northvolt* face headwinds.

items.title: Trump AI energy plan sparks $1B US grid investment
items.summary:
- The administration ties *AI leadership* to *energy infrastructure*, announcing a *$1B Hitachi Energy* investment to expand transformers and bolster the US grid, signaling a shift toward fossil fuels and nuclear over renewables.
- Private-sector momentum follows, with more than *$90B* in commitments, including *Google*'s *$25B* data-center expansion, and the *Stargate* initiative, showing AI scale driving power demand and grid upgrades.
- Critics warn the pivot could weaken climate goals and raise emissions, while supporters argue it would improve grid reliability and advance the US's *AI leadership* amid global competition.

items.title: Gilead launches next-generation manufacturing hub amid $32B spend
items.summary:
- Gilead breaks ground on a *Foster City hub* as part of a **$32B** push to boost domestic biologics, including a five-story, 180,000 sq ft facility. 
- The hub includes a *research center* and *biologics plant*, aiming for 800 direct and 2,200 indirect jobs and ~$43B in value. 
- This onshoring wave features peers like Lilly, J&J, Roche expanding US production with *robotics*, *AI*, and *digital monitoring*.

items.title: Aerospace durability with Polar and Ultima's LEEF layer
items.summary:
- The *LEEF* protection uses an electroformed nickel-cobalt layer on composites to extend component life and fleet reliability.
- It withstands *900°C* temperatures, endures >1,000 hours of salt spray, and can be applied during build or as a retrofit across UAVs, eVTOLs, and aerofoils.
- The near-room-temperature electroforming process minimizes energy and waste, supporting *ESG goals* and **defense readiness**, while reducing lifecycle costs.

items.title: US solar supply chain strengthens with domestic partnerships
items.summary:
- US solar manufacturing is strengthening as **domestic partnerships** and tax incentives drive growth despite *China*'s dominance.
- **T1 Energy** and **Corning** form a vertically integrated US supply chain (Michigan wafers, Austin cells, Dallas assembly), creating ~6,000 jobs by 2026.
- Texas and Georgia hubs, tariffs on Southeast Asian imports, and *domestic-content credits* reshape the market, while upstream wafers and polysilicon remain largely overseas.

items.title: AstraZeneca commits $50B to US drug manufacturing
items.summary:
- AstraZeneca vows a *$50B* US investment by 2030, expanding the company’s domestic footprint and lifting US revenue share from 42% to 50% amid policy shifts and demand.
- Virginia will host the largest manufacturing site, featuring *AI-powered quality control*, *robotics-enabled packaging*, and *real-time analytics*, to speed time-to-market and set a global model.
- Expansion spans six states, including *cell therapy* in Rockville and Tarzana, and *continuous manufacturing* in Coppell, with R&D hubs in Gaithersburg and Cambridge to localize output and strengthen the US *supply chain*.

items.title: techUK award winner, Fayola-Maria Jack, talks about finding the positives in conflict
Paula Yarwood looks at how cloud ERP has evolved
items.summary:
- Cloud ERP is expanding to deliver *agility*, *intelligence* and scalability as manufacturers face rising complexity and regulatory pressures.
- Multi-tenant cloud offers regular updates, strong security, and seamless upgrades, while private and hybrid clouds address data-residency concerns.
- Choosing the right cloud approach depends on risk, ambitions and culture, with partners guiding a composable, API-enabled ERP that fits current needs and future growth.

items.title: PaaS for long-term growth in manufacturing
items.author: Sandy Leyva
items.summary:
- *PaaS shifts CapEx to OpEx, enabling pay-as-you-go usage and freeing capital for innovation and growth.*
- *IoT data and digital twins deliver real-time visibility, proactive maintenance and stronger circularity in asset lifecycles.*
- *Targeting high-maintenance or variable-demand assets can reduce the total cost of ownership and boost sustainability.*

items.title: Five ways to balance human-digital skills in manufacturing
items.summary:
- Collaboration between L&D and leaders to define a clear strategy that blends *human and digital skills*, aligning with workforce needs and budgets. 
- Dynamic, AI-enabled learning that personalizes *just-in-time* and enables *pull/push* learning to re-engage employees and build critical mass. 
- Leaders as learning role models, balancing *face-to-face* and *remote* formats and fostering *supportive learning networks* for sustained development.

items.title: Meeting the demand for mass personalization at scale.
Liberty Pumps: Quality Products and Team Development
items.summary:
- Liberty Pumps is a family- and employee-owned US manufacturer that produces over 90% of its pumps in the **USA**, prioritizing *innovation* and a strong **culture**.
- The leadership highlights their people with extensive benefits such as *wellness*, a **fitness room**, a corporate *chaplain*, and a *therapist*, along with team events like food trucks and extra *vacation days*.
- Liberty has invested in **robotics and automation** (including *robotic CNC cells*) to boost throughput, safety, and ergonomics, with plans for further upgrades and upcoming product launches.

items.title: Horse Powertrain drives diverse Net Zero paths
items.summary:
- Horse Powertrain combines **ICE**, hybrids, and low-emission powertrains across 17 plants and 5 R&D centers to tailor solutions for regional Net Zero goals.
- Its next‑generation range-extender powertrains deliver up to **200 km** EV range plus a **600–800 km** boost from a generator, enabling up to ~**1000 km** with a compact, efficient engine.
- The company embraces a *no one-size-fits-all* approach, pursuing multiple paths from pure ICE to BEV, hybrids, hydrogen, and flex fuels, underpinned by full powertrain integration.

items.title: AI and engineers solving semiconductor data challenges
items.summary:
- Generative AI augments engineers, acting as a *co-pilot* that proposes visualizations, explains results, and automates routine tasks while humans stay in control. 
- Spotfire Copilot and *RAG* ground AI in real data—pulling from logs, specs, and failure reports to cite evidence and keep conclusions explainable. 
- The *hybrid mind*—humans plus AI—accelerates root-cause analysis, enhances knowledge sharing, and supports trustworthy, data-driven decisions.

items.title: IG Doors opens new UK factory
items.summary:
- **£60m** investment creates a 200,000 sq ft, highly automated factory with a 1km production line and real-time digital monitoring to boost quality and speed.
- The plant now **CO2 neutral** and UK-made, with most inputs sourced locally to cut supply-chain risk and support domestic jobs.
- Management aims to grow into new markets and the trade retail sector while keeping sustainability and service at the core.

items.title: Gill Group: customer-centric R&D leadership
items.summary:
- Gill Group, a *family-owned* leader in environmental and industrial sensing, blends four decades of innovation with a *customer-centric* R&D approach that keeps engineers close to real-world challenges.
- The group runs five entities—Gill Instruments, Gill Sensors, Gill R&D, Labcal, and Gill Corporate Inc.—for market-driven solutions with a safety-first culture (ISO 45001).
- Global growth is shaped by US and APAC teams that *listen to customers* to guide roadmaps, earning global recognition such as the King's Award for Enterprise in International Trade.

items.title: TAMKO Leads with Innovative Roofing Vision
items.summary: - **TAMKO** has invested in contractor engagement, a new white-glove service, and a growing **TAMKO Tech Stack** to empower roofers.\n- **ProLine** products like **Titan XT** and **StormFighter FLEX** are award-winning thanks to **TriShield Technology** and performance in extreme conditions.\n- Sustainability advances with **Northstar Clean Technologies** divert shingles from landfills and strengthen TAMKO's supply chain alongside the redefined **TAMKO Edge** contractor program.

items.title: Allied Steel Buildings leads in tough structural projects
items.summary:
- Allied positions itself as a global provider of pre-engineered and hybrid steel structures, offering design, manufacturing, and project management in one partner.
- Recent US expansion in McGregor, Texas—120,000 sq ft fully automated facility—and a Spain operations site, boosted by robotics from Zeman and key partners.
- Aims to be a one-stop solution for high-speed projects in aerospace, data centers, energy, and more, delivering fast lead times and strong quality.

items.title: Palermo Villa expands with new facility
items.summary:
- *Palermo Villa* is opening a new, state‑of‑the‑art bakery near its North American HQ, with 24‑hour dough fermentation, high hydration and a wood‑fired oven to expand artisan breads and pizzas. 
- The family‑owned producer, one of the US’s largest frozen‑pizza makers since 1964, is pursuing continuous improvement and bold collaborations with *Cheez-It®* and *Stranger Things* to grow its brands. 
- The facility will fuel growth across retail, deli and food service, with Palermo planning to use only half the site as it continues to innovate in pizza and bread offerings.

items.title: CAV Systems leads aerospace ice protection
items.summary:
- *CAV Systems* has a heritage of ice protection with *TKS®* and *SLD* systems certified for hundreds of aircraft variants.
- Its *fluid-based anti-ice* technology uses micro-perforation and controlled flow to prevent ice on wings, propellers and gear, enabling seamless integration.
- The company is expanding into *eVTOL* and UAV markets, embedding systems early in design to reduce costs and broaden its technology portfolio.

items.title: Inside VES' AirDoor: cutting energy costs
items.summary:
- *AirDoor* creates an invisible air barrier at commercial entrances, dramatically cutting energy use and reducing the need for draught lobbies. 
- *CFD*-driven airflow control with sensors directs variable-speed fans to counter incoming air and stabilize indoor temperatures. 
- *ISO 14001* focus, zero waste-to-landfill goals, and CSR activities such as Make UK Manufacturing Day demonstrate VES's commitment to sustainability.

items.title: Laitram Machinery: from shrimp peeling to vision tech
items.summary:
- **Laitram Machinery** began with automated shrimp peeling over *75 years ago*, growing into a diversified group with 3,800 employees, 2,200 patents in 12 locations.
- The **CoolSteam** system cooks below 100°C using steam and air, enabling scalable shrimp processing and global adoption (≈300 installations) and IQF products.
- By applying *phase-change* and *convection* physics, Laitram extends beyond shrimp into nuts and other foods, boosting yields by 3–6%, enabling vision grading with the SMART Sorter, and reducing pathogens like *Listeria* via preheating and precise temp control.
